verses.verse: I said <WH559> <WH8804> in mine heart <WH3820>, Go to now <WH3212> <WH8798>, I will prove <WH5254> <WH8762> thee with mirth <WH8057>, therefore enjoy <WH7200> <WH8798> pleasure <WH2896>: and, behold, this also is vanity <WH1892>.
I said <WH559> <WH8804> of laughter <WH7814>, It is mad <WH1984> <WH8781>: and of mirth <WH8057>, What <WH2090> doeth <WH6213> <WH8802> it?

I sought <WH8446> <WH8804> in mine heart <WH3820> to give <WH4900> <WH8800> myself <WH1320> unto wine <WH3196>, yet acquainting <WH5090> <WH8802> mine heart <WH3820> with wisdom <WH2451>; and to lay hold <WH270> <WH8800> on folly <WH5531>, till I might see <WH7200> <WH8799> what was that good <WH2896> for the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120>, which they should do <WH6213> <WH8799> under the heaven <WH8064> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of their life <WH2416>.
I made me great <WH1431> <WH8689> works <WH4639>; I builded <WH1129> <WH8804> me houses <WH1004>; I planted <WH5193> <WH8804> me vineyards <WH3754>:
I made <WH6213> <WH8804> me gardens <WH1593> and orchards <WH6508>, and I planted <WH5193> <WH8804> trees <WH6086> in them of all kind of fruits <WH6529>:
I made <WH6213> <WH8804> me pools <WH1295> of water <WH4325>, to water <WH8248> <WH8687> therewith the wood <WH3293> that bringeth forth <WH6779> <WH8802> trees <WH6086>:

I got <WH7069> <WH8804> me servants <WH5650> and maidens <WH8198>, and had servants born <WH1121> in my house <WH1004>; also I had great <WH7235> <WH8687> possessions <WH4735> of great <WH1241> and small cattle <WH6629> above all that were in Yerushalayim <WH3389> before <WH6440> me:

I gathered <WH3664> <WH8804> me also silver <WH3701> and gold <WH2091>, and the peculiar treasure <WH5459> of kings <WH4428> and of the provinces <WH4082>: I gat <WH6213> <WH8804> me men singers <WH7891> <WH8802> and women singers <WH7891> <WH8802>, and the delights <WH8588> of the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120>, as musical instruments <WH7705> <WH7705>, and that of all sorts.
So I was great <WH1431> <WH8804>, and increased <WH3254> <WH8689> more than all that were before <WH6440> me in Yerushalayim <WH3389>: also my wisdom <WH2451> remained <WH5975> <WH8804> with me.

And whatsoever mine eyes <WH5869> desired <WH7592> <WH8804> I kept <WH680> <WH8804> not from them, I withheld <WH4513> <WH8804> not my heart <WH3820> from any joy <WH8057>; for my heart <WH3820> rejoiced <WH8056> in all my labour <WH5999>: and this was my portion <WH2506> of all my labour <WH5999>.

Then I looked <WH6437> <WH8804> on all the works <WH4639> that my hands <WH3027> had wrought <WH6213> <WH8804>, and on the labour <WH5999> that I had laboured <WH5998> <WH8804> to do <WH6213> <WH8800>: and, behold, all was vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit <WH7307>, and there was no profit <WH3504> under the sun <WH8121>.

And I turned <WH6437> <WH8804> myself to behold <WH7200> <WH8800> wisdom <WH2451>, and madness <WH1947>, and folly <WH5531>: for what can the man <WH120> do that cometh <WH935> <WH8799> after <WH310> the king <WH4428>? even that which hath been already <WH3528> done <WH6213> <WH8804>.
Then I saw <WH7200> <WH8804> that <WH3426> wisdom <WH2451> excelleth <WH3504> folly <WH5531>, as far as light <WH216> excelleth <WH3504> darkness <WH2822>.

The wise man's <WH2450> eyes <WH5869> are in his head <WH7218>; but the fool <WH3684> walketh <WH1980> <WH8802> in darkness <WH2822>: and I myself perceived <WH3045> <WH8804> also that one <WH259> event <WH4745> happeneth <WH7136> <WH8799> to them all.

Then <WH227> said <WH559> <WH8804> I in my heart <WH3820>, As it happeneth <WH4745> to the fool <WH3684>, so it happeneth <WH7136> <WH8799> even to me <WH1571>; and why was I then more <WH3148> wise <WH2449> <WH8804>? Then I said <WH1696> <WH8765> in my heart <WH3820>, that this also is vanity <WH1892>.

For there is no remembrance <WH2146> of the wise <WH2450> more than <WH5973> of the fool <WH3684> for ever <WH5769>; seeing that which now <WH3528> is in the days <WH3117> to come <WH935> <WH8802> shall all be forgotten <WH7911> <WH8738>. And how dieth <WH4191> <WH8799> the wise <WH2450> man? as the fool <WH3684>.

Therefore I hated <WH8130> <WH8804> life <WH2416>; because the work <WH4639> that is wrought <WH6213> <WH8738> under the sun <WH8121> is grievous <WH7451> unto me: for all is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit <WH7307>.

Yea, I hated <WH8130> <WH8804> all my labour <WH5999> which I had taken <WH6001> under the sun <WH8121>: because I should leave <WH3240> <WH8686> it unto the man <WH120> that shall be after <WH310> me.

And who knoweth <WH3045> <WH8802> whether he shall be a wise <WH2450> man or a fool <WH5530>? yet shall he have rule <WH7980> <WH8799> over all my labour <WH5999> wherein I have laboured <WH5998> <WH8804>, and wherein I have shewed myself wise <WH2449> <WH8804> under the sun <WH8121>. This is also vanity <WH1892>.
Therefore I went about <WH5437> <WH8804> to cause <WH2976> my heart <WH3820> to despair <WH2976> <WH8763> of all the labour <WH5999> which I took <WH5998> <WH8804> under the sun <WH8121>.

For there is <WH3426> a man <WH120> whose labour <WH5999> is in wisdom <WH2451>, and in knowledge <WH1847>, and in equity <WH3788>; yet to a man <WH120> that hath not laboured <WH5998> <WH8804> therein shall he leave <WH5414> <WH8799> it for his portion <WH2506>. This also is vanity <WH1892> and a great <WH7227> evil <WH7451>.
For what hath <WH1933> <WH8802> man <WH120> of all his labour <WH5999>, and of the vexation <WH7475> of his heart <WH3820>, wherein <WH1931> he hath laboured <WH6001> under the sun <WH8121> ?
For all his days <WH3117> are sorrows <WH4341>, and his travail <WH6045> grief <WH3708>; yea, his heart <WH3820> taketh not rest <WH7901> <WH8804> in the night <WH3915>. This is also vanity <WH1892>.

There is nothing better <WH2896> for a man <WH120>, than that he should eat <WH398> <WH8799> and drink <WH8354> <WH8804>, and that he should make his soul <WH5315> enjoy <WH7200> <WH8689> good <WH2896> in his labour <WH5999>. This <WH2090> also I saw <WH7200> <WH8804>, that it was from the hand <WH3027> of 'Elohim <WH430>.
For who can eat <WH398> <WH8799>, or who else can hasten <WH2363> <WH8799> hereunto, more <WH2351> than I?

For 'Elohim giveth <WH5414> <WH8804> to a man <WH120> that is good <WH2896> in his sight <WH6440> wisdom <WH2451>, and knowledge <WH1847>, and joy <WH8057>: but to the sinner <WH2398> <WH8802> he giveth <WH5414> <WH8804> travail <WH6045>, to gather <WH622> <WH8800> and to heap up <WH3664> <WH8800>, that he may give <WH5414> <WH8800> to him that is good <WH2896> before <WH6440> 'Elohim <WH430>. This also is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit <WH7307>.
